A great game when you don't find hackers. Valve really needs to rethink VAC or rework the engine in such a manner that cheating is way harder. If you want to enjoy an arcade fps game with friends it's fantastic, but I would recommend paying for Faceit in order to avoid the inevitable frustration of being matched against hackers...

Operation: Shattered Web is an absolute cluster F***. I will say, Valve has something up their sleeves, because they don't care about anybody hacking in Silver ranks. Therefore, you need to find a competent 5-man team who can communicate to get into gold, then it gets better from there.

This video game, Counter Strike Source, is the worst turn based game ever created. The turn system never works and it always allows the other players to have unlimited turns and defeat me. 2/10, would not recommend.

CSGO is known for its insanely high skill ceiling and precise gunplay. Both of these factors contribute to mass replayability as you can constantly strive to improve your own skills rather than leveling up your in-game character. While casual players can most certainly have fun, particularly in modes outside of "competitive" (go figure), CSGO is more targeted at players that want a game that requires more skill usage and less spraying and praying. Definitely worth full price, and if you allow yourself to learn and grow instead of tilting, CSGO will provide a joyful challenge for many years to come.
